page.title: 06Aberdare By_Pass System
page.content: The by_pass was built because the old road could not cope with the transport problems of the area.Work started in 1982.Permission was granted by the Welsh Office and Mid_Glamorgan Road and Highways Department.It was partly financed by the European Development Fund. The road has caused a lot of controversey because many of the previously quiet side streets such as Trefelin and Harriet and Meirion Street are now very busy and very noisy because the heavy traffic travel along them to gain access to the by_pass. We interviewed a resident of Meirion St. about the noise,fumes and congestions. He thought the new road was a good idea but it left a lot to be desired because there is more noise now.
